question_stem.en: A 16-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department because of confusion, fatigue, and abdominal pain. He has also experienced excessive thirst and polyuria during the last 3 weeks. His past medical history is insignificant. Family history is unremarkable. Urine dipstick is positive for glucose and ketones.
question_stem.zh: 一名16岁男孩因意识模糊、疲劳和腹痛被送往急诊科。在过去3周内，他还经历了过度口渴和多尿。他的既往病史无特殊。家族史无特殊。尿液试纸对葡萄糖和酮体呈阳性。

question.en: Which of the following factors most likely contributed to the development of this patient's condition?
question.zh: 以下哪种因素最有可能促成了该患者病情的发展？

C.zh: 胰岛素分泌的遗传缺陷

explanation.en:
This patient is presenting with diabetic ketoacidosis, a condition that most commonly affects patients with TYPE 1 diabetes mellitus due to their absolute insulin deficiency. Type 1 diabetes mellitus occurs in genetically susceptible individuals who are exposed to triggering environmental factors (eg, viral infections, environmental toxins, dietary components). This results in an autoimmune response against pancreatic beta cells that leads to progressive loss of beta cell mass {{exhibit_1}}. Overt manifestations of diabetes mellitus tend to develop once >90% of beta cells are destroyed. Although antibodies against islet antigens are detected in a large number of patients, they are thought to play a permissive role in disease pathogenesis; the destruction of beta cells occurs primarily through cell-mediated immunity. Infiltration of islets by inflammatory cells is called insulitis and is more prominent during the early stages of disease.

(Choices A and B) Abdominal fat deposition and excessive body weight are important contributors to insulin resistance and development of type 2 diabetes mellitus. Intra-abdominal visceral fat is more strongly related to insulin resistance than is subcutaneous fat.

(Choice C) Maturity-onset diabetes of the young is an autosomal dominant disease caused by mutations that impair glucose sensing and insulin secretion by pancreatic beta cells. It presents as non-insulin-dependent diabetes at a young age (<25) and accounts for <5% of all cases of diabetes mellitus.

(Choice D) Islet amyloid polypeptide is secreted along with insulin from pancreatic beta cells. Amyloid deposition occurs in the islets of patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus, although its role as a causative agent of beta cell dysfunction remains unknown. Patients with type 1 diabetes mellitus have low circulating levels of islet amyloid polypeptide due to extensive beta cell destruction.
explanation.zh:
该患者表现为糖尿病酮症酸中毒，这是一种最常影响1型糖尿病患者的疾病，原因是他们绝对的胰岛素缺乏。1型糖尿病发生在对环境因素（如病毒感染、环境毒素、膳食成分）敏感的遗传易感个体中。这会导致针对胰腺β细胞的自身免疫反应，导致β细胞质量进行性丧失{{exhibit_1}}。一旦超过90%的β细胞被破坏，糖尿病的明显表现就会出现。尽管在大量患者中检测到针对胰岛抗原的抗体，但它们被认为在疾病发病机制中起许可作用；β细胞的破坏主要通过细胞介导的免疫力发生。炎症细胞浸润胰岛被称为胰岛炎，在疾病的早期阶段更为突出。

（选项A和B）腹部脂肪沉积和体重超重是导致胰岛素抵抗和2型糖尿病发展的重要因素。内腹部内脏脂肪与胰岛素抵抗的关系比皮下脂肪更密切。

（选项C）青年发病型糖尿病（MODY）是一种常染色体显性遗传病，由损害胰腺β细胞的葡萄糖感知和胰岛素分泌的突变引起。它在年轻时（<25岁）表现为非胰岛素依赖型糖尿病，占所有糖尿病病例的<5%。

（选项D）胰岛淀粉样多肽与胰岛素一起从胰腺β细胞分泌。淀粉样蛋白沉积发生在2型糖尿病患者的胰岛中，尽管其作为β细胞功能障碍的病因的作用仍然未知。由于β细胞的大量破坏，1型糖尿病患者的循环胰岛淀粉样多肽水平较低。

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of the pathophysiology of type 1 diabetes mellitus, specifically the autoimmune destruction of pancreatic beta cells leading to insulin deficiency and diabetic ketoacidosis.

The key to solving this question is recognizing the patient's presentation as diabetic ketoacidosis and understanding that type 1 diabetes is primarily caused by autoimmune-mediated destruction of islet cells, resulting in insulitis.
summary.zh:
本题考察对1型糖尿病病理生理学的了解，特别是针对胰腺β细胞的自身免疫破坏，导致胰岛素缺乏和糖尿病酮症酸中毒。

解决此问题的关键在于将患者的临床表现识别为糖尿病酮症酸中毒，并理解1型糖尿病主要由自身免疫介导的胰岛细胞破坏引起，导致胰岛炎。
